  • All Classes Interface Summary Class Summary Exception Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractSizedBatchCollector<B>
    A default scaffolding SizedBatchCollector, which has a getter for AbstractSizedBatchCollector.maxBatchSize() and a default value for it.
    AlphaNumComparator<T>
    The Alphanum Algorithm is an improved sorting algorithm for strings containing numbers.
    ArraySearchUtils
    Utilities about searches over arrays.
    BatchCollector<B>
    ## The Batch Collector A batch collector is a container of methods to manage matches during the operations of BatchProcessor.
    BatchProcessor<B,​BC extends BatchCollector<B>,​BJ extends Consumer<B>>
    ## Batch Processor Skeleton A simple skeleton to manage processing of data in multi-thread mode.
    BatchService<TK extends BatchServiceTask>
    A pool-based thread execution service, that dynamically optimises its size.
    BatchServiceTask
    Used by BatchService.
    BatchServiceTask.TaskComparator
    Provides a task comparison based on BatchServiceTask.getPriority() (higher priorities comes first).
    CausalNumberFormatException
    A NumberFormatException that allows to include a reference to what caused the exception.
    ChainExecutor
    An Executor that is able to chain/stack two other executors.
    CleaningObject
    Simulates the old finalize() method in Java >= 9.
    CollectionBasedBatchProcessor<E,​B extends Collection<E>,​BC extends CollectionBatchCollector<B,​E>,​BJ extends Consumer<B>>
    An item-based batch processor that is based on Java collection batches.
    CollectionBatchCollector<C extends Collection<E>,​E>
    Collectors of this type are dedicated to Java collections.
    DynamicRateExecutor
    Like RateLimitedExecutor, but contains a hook where you can dynamically decide which new rate you want to set.
    ExceptionUtils
    Utilities related to exception handling.
    HackedBlockingQueue<E>
    Tricks the behaviour of LinkedBlockingQueue so that methods like HackedBlockingQueue.offer(Object) and HackedBlockingQueue.poll() actually invoke LinkedBlockingQueue.put(Object) and LinkedBlockingQueue.take(), i.e., the queue always waits for itself to be free-of/filled-with-some value/s.
    IdUtils
    Utilities about management of identifiers.
    ItemizedBatchCollector<B,​E>
    A batch collector that can be populated one item at a time.
    ItemizedBatchProcessor<E,​B,​BC extends ItemizedBatchCollector<B,​E>,​BJ extends Consumer<B>>
    ## Item-based batch processor.
    ItemizedSizedBatchCollector<B,​E>
    A common type of batch collector which manages a flow of items as input and which considers the batch full when it has accumulated a given number of items.
    ListBasedBatchProcessor<E,​BJ extends Consumer<List<E>>>  
    ListBatchCollector<E>
    Uses ArrayList as default and the default max size provided by AbstractSizedBatchCollector.
    ListUtils
    Miscellanea utilities about lists.
    MapCollection<K,​V>
    Creates a view of a Map that is a collection.
    MemoryUtils
    An helper that allows to release/reset resources when free memory goes beyond a given limit.
    MultipleAttemptsExecutor
    An executor to attempt an operation multiple times, knowing it can fail from time to time (e.g.
    ObjectStore<T,​K,​V>
    Implements an object store.
    Pair<V,​T>
    An implementation of the famous Pair interface, as it is found in some package and in discussions about whether it is necessary or not to have it in java.util.
    PercentProgressLogger
    It's like ProgressLogger but reports percentages, given a max value that you set initially.
    PoolSizeTuner
    A Thread Pool Size Optimiser
    ProgressLogger
    Reports (using a logger) the progress of some process, represented by a long number.
    RateLimitedExecutor
    A rate limiting executor, based on RateLimiter.
    ReflectionUtils
    Jan 15, 2008
    RegEx
    An helper class for the regex library.
    SetBasedBatchProcessor<E,​BJ extends Consumer<Set<E>>>  
    SetBatchCollector<E>
    Uses HashSet as default and the default max size provided by AbstractSizedBatchCollector.
    SimpleCache<K,​V> Deprecated.
    Use CacheBuilder.
    SizedBatchCollector<B>
    A batch collector such that the batch ready flag can be based on a batch size and a max size parameter.
    SortedObjectStore<T,​K,​V>
    Like ObjectStore, but with types and keys kept sorted.
    StatsExecutor
    An executor logs statistics on the executions it receive to run.
    StreamUtils
    Stream Utils
    StringSearchUtils  
    TestOutputDecorator
    # An output decorator for JUnit Logs a nice header with the test name before the test and a similar trailer afterward.
    ThreadUtils  
    TooFewValuesException
    Some operation has met too few values unexpectedly, eg, a collection is empty.
    TooManyValuesException
    Some operation has met too many values unexpectedly.
    TupleIterator<T>
    Takes an array of iterators and returns an iterator of tuples.
    TupleSpliterator<T>
    Takes an array of spliterators and returns a spliterator of tuples.
    TypeCastCollection<T>
    Allows to type-cast the collection of super-type T1 into the sub-type T (i.e., T extends T1), which is not permitted by the Java generics.
    UncheckedFileNotFoundException
    An unchecked version of FileNotFoundException.
    UncheckedInterruptedException
    An unchecked version of InterruptedException.
    UnexpectedEventException
    To be used when the execution flow of a program has met an event that is unusual, rare, or alike.
    UnexpectedValueException
    An operation has met some unexpected value.
    XPathReader
    Created by the ISA team Modified from example here: http://www.javabeat.net/tips/182-how-to-query-xml-using-xpath.html
    XStopWatch
    A StopWatch with extended functionality.
